result: You come across a cute green cottage that smells of freshly baked cookies.
You knock on the door and large slime slowly oozes out to meet you.
Within the slime you notice a rolling pin, an apron and glasses.
You feel something in your backpack shift in excitement.

options.text: Take the slime out of the backpack

result: You defeated the slime!
Your slime friend works its way out of the backpack.
It looks around seems excited, almost as though it recognises the place.
It looks around but it seems dissapointed.
Was it expecting someone?
You defeated the slime!
You feel empty.
You take out your slime baby from earlier.
Both slimes start squelching happily.
It looks as though you've bought the slime to one of its relatives.
The larger slime gives you what appears to be slime.
While you may have lost a friend, you gained an item and a sense of fulfilment
You have received the blessing of the slimes.

description: Basalt Cliffs Stage 6, player finds embers.

result: After defeating the slime, you keep trekking. Hoping to find something cool.
You find a pile of cooling embers that faintly tremble. It's the remains of an ember slime, flickering but almost gone.
It hurts you to see its glow struggling in its final moments.
What should you do?

options.text: Put it out of its misery.

result: You kneel and blow gently upon the ember.
Your breath stirs the fading glow. The ember flares brightly, growing into a tiny flame... it worked!
You blow and you blow, but the ember only grows colder.
You glance around, desparate to find fuel for the dying slime.
You can hear the bubble of a lava pool, maybe there's something in there?
Further ahead, there's jagged rocks with something wedged between them. You think its firewood.
But if there's nothing... maybe use the basalt instead?
What do you do?

options.text: Check out the cooling lava pool.

result: Now that you're at the lava pool you feel silly. There's no way wood would survive here.
Now that you're at the lava pool you feel silly. There's no way wood would survive here.
You solemnly walk back to the ember, maybe you'll find something on your way back. Though there was nothing on your way here either.
Returning to the ember you see its soft glow is even softer.
Now that you're at the lava pool you feel silly. There's no way wood would survive here.
Wait...! Maybe you're not dumb? There's something laying just on the edge of the pool.
It's firewood! You rush back to the ember, placing the wood gently around it.
You watch as its light catches onto the pieces of wood, then pwooOOSH! It flares back to life.
You scramble across the jagged terrain, scanning every crevice
Between two basalt spikes you spot blackened wood fragments, remnants of a burnt tree.
You gather what you can and run back.
You trip on the uneven terrain, losing 2 HP
You get back up again, it's only a scratch. The ember is more important.
You place the burnt wood gently around the ember, it catches alight instantly!
You stack small basalt rocks around the ember, hoping it's good enough.
The rocks smother the last flicker of flame. Oh.
The lively flame reshapes into a small fire slime.
It bounces around joyfully, sparks dancing in the air.
Though you feel happy, you were expecting a reward.
It senses your greed, but its still thankful.
The slime blesses you.
The slime continues to bounce around, and bounce, and oh? It's gone.
Wait.. it left something behind. Is this another gift? Or an accident? You don't care.
The ember shudders once, then fades to ash.
You feel cold.
As you stare solemnly at where the ember once was, you notice something.

description: OH SNAP TIS A TAX SLIME

result: So there you were minding your own stinky business.
WHEN suddenly, a slime wearing a hypothetical business suit emerges from a hypothetical trash can!
IT IS I! THE TAX SLIME!
YOU HAVEN'T PAID YOUR TAXES!
WE TAKE TAX FRAUD FAR TOO SERIOUSLY! PREPARE TO hypothetically DIE!!!!
OUUUGGGHHHHH WHYYYYYYYY
HOW COULD YOU DO THIS TO MEEEEE
I HAD A WIFE AND THREE CHILDREN
As the life allegedly dies from his eyes, you manage to successfully steal his wallet. GGWP
A loud SLOSH echos nearby, something heavy just droped into the muck.
The ground trembles as a huge, wobbling mass jumps into view.
It jiggles once... then twice... and lets out a deep blob.
BLOP! Blurrp! bloorb!
The massive slime jiggles proudly, as if daring you to hit it.
The slime trembles and slowly collapses into a sagging heap of jelly.
Inside the collapsing blob, you spot countless shiny things glimmering faintly.
With a hesitant breath, you close your eyes and shove your hand into the sticky jelly
You manage to pull something free before you lose your nerve.
UPDATE
UPDATE
UPDATE
It's been a long time since you last saw anyone.
You hear a twig snap in the distance.
Three bandits come out from the trees.
You're either gonna have to part with a bit of that health, by choice or we'll take all of it forcefully.
Do you...
Before the leader can react, you charge head first at him.
The leader is knocked out.
You glare at the now frightened thugs.
Hey pal I don't want any trouble!
Yeah look just take what's in my pockets and we'll get out of here.
The thugs grab their leader and run away
Begrudgingly, you hand over 10 health
You feel weaker
Smart move pal.
The bandits return to the shadows.
You wonder if you would've been better off fighting them.
You walked into the burning mountain overlooking a bubbling river of lava.
You hear furious shouting echoing from deep inside the fiery caverns.
You follow the sound of shouting and sizzling until you find two dragons standing over bubbling vents.
They're waving spoons and spatulas, arguing so loudly that your eardrums ache.
"Mine's clearly the best!" argues the red dragon, slamming his tail against the ground.
"Yours tastes like a burnt pebble!" shouts the other, another red dragon puffing smoke.
When they spot you, their eyes light up. "Perfect! A taster!"
"Perfect timing, traveler! Tell us whose cooking is the best chief in this land!"
WHat do you do?
You took a small sip of the first dragon's stew. While he stares at you with confidence.
It's smoky, rich and immediately sets your tongue on fire.
The dragon grins proudly as you cough smoke.
Your throat burns and lose 2 HP
But you can now burn your opponent with your firery breath.
You complimented his cooking and thanked him for his unique cuisine while slowly slipping away.
The first dragon is still boasting, and the second is rolling his eyes.
Before they start arguing again, you make your escape, lips still tingling from the taste of stew.
You try the second stew, it smells sweet, like caramelized rock.
As it flows down your throat, your stomach twists, then rumbles.
Heat spreads through your whole body. You feel lightheaded, like you've swallowed a small volcano.
The black dragon grins. "Refined, isn't it? It warms up your whole body."
Your feel hot...
fire's burnning inside you.
You bravely take a spoonful from both bowls at once.
The stews react together, sweet, smoky, and painfully spicy.
A volcano seems to erupt in your stomach, but somehow, you feel stronger from it.
You gained the status hiccup of doom.
Both dragons stares at you waiting for your response.
"Well?" they both lean in close."Which one is better" they ask in perfect union.
Who do you pick?
The dragon laughs, "Finally! Someone with taste!"
"Here, take this... A little present from the greatest chief in this land."
The second dragon gives a satisfied snort.
"Finally! Someone who appreciates true spice!"
He scoops up a ladle of his bubbling stew and carefully pours it into a thick glass bottle.
Here, if you like it so much, I'll give you more...
You try to refuse politely, saying you're full.
Both chefs gasp in offense.
"Full? No one leaves a dragon's feast untasted!"they roar together in anger.
They toss aside their spoons, smoke curling from their nostrils.
You're about to regret your life choices.
The first dragon backs up while the second rushes toward you.
Prepare for the second round!
As the smoke clears, both dragons lie slumped against the lava vents, exhausted and steaming.
"Fine... maybe you just weren't ready for true flavor," mutters the first one.
"Come back when your stomach is braver," adds the second dragon, faintly amused.
You leave the cavern smelling of chili and victory.
